values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (random values returned)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual sensor data via I2C

simulate.purpose: Determines whether the sensor operates in simulation or real hardware mode

addr.purpose: I2C address of the MPU6050 sensor

_accel.purpose: Holds acceleration values on X, Y, Z axes

_gyro.purpose: Holds gyroscope angular velocity values on X, Y, Z axes

read_accel.purpose: Returns a tuple of X, Y, Z acceleration values

read_gyro.purpose: Returns a tuple of X, Y, Z gyroscope values

read_all.purpose: Returns both accelerometer and gyroscope readings in one call

parameters.name: i2c
parameters.purpose: I2C bus instance used to communicate with the sensor

parameters.name: addr
parameters.purpose: I2C address of the MPU6050 sensor (default is 0x68)

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Simulated data (random values)
values_meaning.false: Real hardware readings

parameters.purpose: Enables simulation mode if set to true

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the DHT sensor

sensor_type.purpose: Specifies the type of DHT sensor being used

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (random temperature and humidity values)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual data from the connected sensor

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the sensor operates in simulation or real mode

_temp.purpose: Latest measured temperature value. Valid range: -40°C to 125°C

_humidity.purpose: Latest measured humidity value. Valid range: 0% to 100%

measure.purpose: Triggers the sensor to update temperature and humidity readings

temperature.purpose: Returns the last measured temperature value. Range: -40°C to 125°C

humidity.purpose: Returns the last measured humidity value. Range: 0% to 100%

constructor.purpose: Initializes the DHT sensor (DHT11 or DHT22) with the specified GPIO pin, sensor type, and simulation mode.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the DHT sensor

parameters.name: sensor_type
parameters.purpose: Specifies the type of DHT sensor being used

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Sensor data will be simulated using random values
values_meaning.false: Sensor will read actual values via GPIO

parameters.purpose: Controls whether the sensor operates in simulation or real mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the DHTSensor class ready for measuring temperature and humidity

pin_a.purpose: GPIO pin A for encoder signal input

pin_b.purpose: GPIO pin B for encoder signal input

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (position manually controlled via code)
values_meaning.false: Reads real encoder signals from pins

simulate.purpose: Determines whether encoder is in simulation or real hardware mode

_position.purpose: Current position of the encoder (increments/decrements on rotation)

returns.purpose: Returns the current position of the encoder

reset.purpose: Resets the encoder position back to zero

steps.purpose: Number of steps to increment or decrement position (for simulate mode)

simulate_step.purpose: Manually updates the encoder position during simulation mode

constructor.purpose: Initializes the rotary encoder with two pins. Supports simulation or real hardware interrupts for position tracking.

parameters.name: pin_a
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin connected to encoder channel A

parameters.name: pin_b
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin connected to encoder channel B

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Enables simulation mode, position can be changed manually
values_meaning.false: Enables real hardware mode using interrupts on GPIO pins

parameters.purpose: Controls whether the encoder operates in simulation or real mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the Encoder class used to track rotary position

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the Gas sensor

values_meaning.true: Analog mode enabled (reads a range of values from 0 to 1023)
values_meaning.false: Digital mode enabled (reads values 0 or 1)

analog.purpose: Specifies whether the sensor is working in analog or digital mode

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (random gas level values)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual data from the connected sensor

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the sensor operates in simulation or real mode

_gas_level.purpose: Latest gas level reading. Range: 0 to 1023 (for analog mode) or 0/1 (for digital mode)

read.purpose: Reads the current gas level from the sensor. Range: 0 to 1023 (analog) or 0/1 (digital)

constructor.purpose: Initializes the gas sensor, either in simulation mode or using a real analog/digital input pin.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number to which the gas sensor is connected

parameters.name: analog

values_meaning.true: Uses analog pin and ADC to read varying gas levels
values_meaning.false: Uses digital pin to detect gas presence (binary value)

parameters.purpose: Determines if the sensor is analog or digital

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Sensor values are simulated randomly
values_meaning.false: Reads actual values from the connected hardware

parameters.purpose: Controls whether the sensor operates in simulation or real mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the GasSensor class ready for reading gas levels

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the LED

values_meaning.true: LED is turned ON when pin is high (1)
values_meaning.false: LED is turned ON when pin is low (0)

active_high.purpose: Determines if the LED is active high or low

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (LED behavior simulated)
values_meaning.false: Controls an actual LED on the connected GPIO pin

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the LED operates in simulation or real mode

values_meaning.true: LED is ON
values_meaning.false: LED is OFF

_state.purpose: Tracks the current state of the LED (ON/OFF)

on.purpose: Turns the LED ON (sets the state to ON)

off.purpose: Turns the LED OFF (sets the state to OFF)

switch.label: Switch
switch.purpose: Switch the led ON or OFF, according to parameter value

parameters.name: status
parameters.purpose: the status boolean value, true : led on, false : led off

toggle.purpose: Toggles the state of the LED (ON if OFF, OFF if ON)

is_on.purpose: Returns the current state of the LED (True if ON, False if OFF)

constructor.purpose: Initializes the LED object to control a digital output pin, either in simulation or hardware mode.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the LED

parameters.name: active_high

values_meaning.true: LED turns ON when the GPIO pin is set HIGH
values_meaning.false: LED turns ON when the GPIO pin is set LOW

parameters.purpose: Controls whether the LED is active-high or active-low

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Simulated LED behavior (no real hardware interaction)
values_meaning.false: Real LED control via hardware GPIO

parameters.purpose: Enables or disables simulation mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the LED class ready for digital output control

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (LED behavior simulated)
values_meaning.false: Controls an actual internal LED on GPIO2

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the internal LED operates in simulation or real mode

on.purpose: Turns the internal LED ON (sets the state to ON)

off.purpose: Turns the internal LED OFF (sets the state to OFF)

switch.label: Switch
switch.purpose: Switch the led ON or OFF, according to parameter value

parameters.name: status
parameters.purpose: the status boolean value, true : led on, false : led off

toggle.purpose: Toggles the state of the internal LED (ON if OFF, OFF if ON)

is_on.purpose: Returns the current state of the internal LED (True if ON, False if OFF)

constructor.purpose: Initializes the internal LED, typically connected to GPIO2 on ESP32 boards. Inherits behavior from the LED base class.

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: LED behavior will be simulated with print statements instead of real hardware interaction
values_meaning.false: Controls the actual onboard LED

parameters.purpose: Determines whether the internal LED runs in simulation mode or hardware mode

inherited_parameters.name: pin
inherited_parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number for the internal LED (fixed to 2 for ESP32)

inherited_parameters.name: active_high
inherited_parameters.purpose: Indicates if the LED turns on with a HIGH signal

returns.purpose: An instance of InternalLED, ready to be turned on or off

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the Motion sensor (PIR)

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (random motion detection)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual motion data from the connected sensor

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the sensor operates in simulation or real mode

values_meaning.true: Motion detected
values_meaning.false: No motion detected

_motion_detected.purpose: Indicates whether motion has been detected or not

values_meaning.true: Motion detected
values_meaning.false: No motion detected

read.purpose: Reads the current state of the motion sensor

values_meaning.true: Motion detected within timeout
values_meaning.false: No motion detected within timeout

timeout.purpose: Timeout duration to wait for motion detection

wait_for_motion.purpose: Waits for motion detection for a specified timeout period

constructor.purpose: Initializes the motion sensor for detecting motion either in simulation mode or using a real GPIO pin.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the motion sensor

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Sensor data will be simulated (random motion values)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual motion detection data from the connected pin

parameters.purpose: Whether to operate in simulation mode or real mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the MotionSensor class ready for detecting motion

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the PushButton

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (manual control of button state)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual state from the physical button

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the button operates in simulation or real mode

debounce_ms.purpose: Debounce time in milliseconds to prevent false triggering from button presses

_last_state.purpose: Stores the last known state of the button (True = pressed, False = released)

_last_time.purpose: Stores the last time the button state was changed (in ms)

_simulated_state.purpose: Used only in simulation mode to manually control the button state

was_pressed.purpose: Indicates whether the button was pressed (can be used to detect button press events)

values_meaning.true: Simulates button pressed
values_meaning.false: Simulates button released

pressed.purpose: Sets the simulated state of the button (only used in simulation mode)

values_meaning.true: Button is pressed
values_meaning.false: Button is released

is_pressed.purpose: Checks if the button is pressed or released, applies debounce logic

push.purpose: Simulates a button press and release cycle (only for simulation mode)

values_meaning.true: Button was pressed
values_meaning.false: No button press detected

get_event.purpose: Returns and clears the `was_pressed` flag indicating whether the button was pressed

constructor.purpose: Initializes a push button instance, optionally in simulation mode, with support for debounce handling.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the push button

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Button state is simulated
values_meaning.false: Button state is read from the physical hardware pin

parameters.purpose: Specifies whether the button is in simulation mode

parameters.name: debounce_ms
parameters.purpose: Debounce duration to prevent false multiple button presses

returns.purpose: An instance of the PushButton class ready for state reading and event handling

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the Relay module

values_meaning.true: Relay is active when set to HIGH
values_meaning.false: Relay is active when set to LOW

active_high.purpose: Defines whether the relay is activated when the pin is HIGH or LOW

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (manual relay state control)
values_meaning.false: Controls actual relay hardware connected to the pin

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the relay operates in simulation or real mode

values_meaning.true: Relay is ON
values_meaning.false: Relay is OFF

_state.purpose: Stores the current state of the relay (ON or OFF)

on.purpose: Turns the relay ON (sets pin to HIGH or LOW based on active_high)

off.purpose: Turns the relay OFF (sets pin to LOW or HIGH based on active_high)

toggle.purpose: Toggles the relay state between ON and OFF

is_on.purpose: Returns the current state of the relay (True if ON, False if OFF)

constructor.purpose: Initializes the Relay, sets up control pin behavior and simulation mode.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the relay control input

parameters.name: active_high

values_meaning.true: Relay is activated when the pin is set to HIGH
values_meaning.false: Relay is activated when the pin is set to LOW

parameters.purpose: Determines the logic level that activates the relay

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Relay behavior is simulated with console output
values_meaning.false: Relay controls actual GPIO pin

parameters.purpose: Controls whether the relay operates in simulation or real mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the Relay class ready to control relay operations

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the Servo motor

freq.purpose: PWM frequency for the servo signal

min_us.purpose: Minimum pulse width in microseconds (corresponds to min_deg)

max_us.purpose: Maximum pulse width in microseconds (corresponds to max_deg)

_angle.purpose: Current angle of the servo motor (in degrees)

write.label: Write Angle (Degrees)

parameters.name: deg
parameters.purpose: Angle in degrees to move the servo to

write.purpose: Sets the servo motor to the given angle in degrees

write_rad.label: Write Angle (Radians)

parameters.name: rad
parameters.purpose: Angle in radians to move the servo to

write_rad.purpose: Sets the servo angle using radians

read.label: Read Angle (Degrees)

returns.purpose: Returns the current angle of the servo

read.purpose: Returns the current servo angle in degrees

read_rad.label: Read Angle (Radians)

returns.purpose: Returns the current servo angle in radians

read_rad.purpose: Returns the current servo angle in radians

write_us.label: Write Pulse Width

parameters.name: us
parameters.purpose: Directly sets the pulse width in microseconds

write_us.purpose: Sets the pulse width directly for advanced control

read_us.label: Read Pulse Width

returns.purpose: Returns the current pulse width in microseconds

read_us.purpose: Returns the pulse width currently sent to the servo

off.label: Turn Off
off.purpose: Turns off the PWM signal to the servo

constructor.purpose: Initializes a Servo motor using PWM on a specified pin and angle-to-pulse mapping.

parameters.name: pin_id
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the servo signal wire

parameters.name: min_us
parameters.purpose: Minimum pulse width in microseconds for min_deg

parameters.name: max_us
parameters.purpose: Maximum pulse width in microseconds for max_deg

parameters.name: min_deg
parameters.purpose: Minimum angle in degrees (default 0°)

parameters.name: max_deg
parameters.purpose: Maximum angle in degrees (default 180°)

parameters.name: freq
parameters.purpose: PWM frequency for controlling the servo (default 50Hz)

returns.purpose: An instance of the Servo class ready for angle or pulse control

pin.purpose: GPIO pin number connected to the slide switch

values_meaning.true: Simulation mode enabled (state is manually set)
values_meaning.false: Reads actual hardware pin state

simulate.purpose: Controls whether the switch operates in simulation or real mode

values_meaning.true: Switch is ON
values_meaning.false: Switch is OFF

_state.purpose: Internal switch state when in simulation mode

values_meaning.true: Simulates turning the switch ON
values_meaning.false: Simulates turning the switch OFF

set_simulated_state.purpose: Sets the internal state of the switch during simulation

values_meaning.true: Switch is ON
values_meaning.false: Switch is OFF

read.purpose: Reads the current switch state (either simulated or from the actual pin)

values_meaning.true: Switch is ON
values_meaning.false: Switch is OFF

state.purpose: Property alias for reading the switch state

constructor.purpose: Initializes the SlideSwitch on the given GPIO pin. Can operate in real or simulated mode.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.purpose: GPIO pin number to which the slide switch is connected

parameters.name: simulate

values_meaning.true: Simulated mode enabled; state changes can be simulated programmatically
values_meaning.false: Reads the actual hardware state of the slide switch

parameters.purpose: Determines whether the switch operates in simulation or real hardware mode

returns.purpose: An instance of the SlideSwitch class ready for use
